intro: Navarretia eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's navarretia, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant grows in rocky habitats, often in open areas with well-drained soil. It is known for its small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
